Big Game
whitetail - Basic Shoulder
Starts at $350

Pick from a variety of poses mounted from the shoulder up.

whitetail - Pedestal Mount
Starts at $400

Pedestal mounts look great and show off more of the deer being mounted

whitetail - European Skull Mount
Starts at $100

Comes with an optional gloss coating. Patterned dips also avaialble at an extra cost

Additional Mount Items
Ask

Adding things such as habitat, boards, floor pedistals, name plates, and so on can add a unique look to any mount

Fish
Skin Mount
Starts at $10 inch

A skin mount uses the skin and scales from the exact fish you caught

Replica Mount
Starts at $20 inch

After gathering the proper measurement and picutes a replica mount can be made matching the exact fish you caught.

Additional Mount Items
Ask

Adding things such as habitat, boards, floor pedistals, name plates, and so on can add a unique look to any mount

Birds
TURKEY - Fan Mount
Starts at $75

Show off your turkey's fan, beard, and spurs

TURKEY - Breast Mount
Starts at $250

A full size turkey mount can take a lot of space. a breast mount though is a good middle option between a basic fan mount and fill life size turkey mount

TURKEY - Life Size
Starts at $400

Show off your full size turkey in a variety of avialble poses

Migratory Birds
Coming Soon

Currently I am not taking in any federal migratory birds such as ducks, but will be in the near future

Additional Mount Items
Ask

Adding things such as habitat, boards, floor pedistals, name plates, and so on can add a unique look to any mount

Important Information

Before any work can be taken in I have to have the hunters license and tag infomation, location of kill, and a 50% depoist.

Due to state regulations I'm unable to take in any deer from a state that has had any cases of CWD.

Certificates

  • SCC - Deer Heads / Birds & Waterfowl Taxidermy Course
  • SCC - Small Game and Fish Course
  • SCC - Advanced Taxidermy Course
  • NC Wildlife Resources Commission - Chronic Wasting Disease Sample Collection Training

Starting in 2017 I began taking courses at Surry Community College to learn the taxidermy trade. Since starting my studies I've earned both college and state certificates.
